verbose_text: In the present study, miR-29a exhibited the highest fold change, and it should also be noted that in previous studies miR-29a has been shown to be critical in inhibiting insulin stimulated glucose uptake in 3T3-L1 adipocytes, and it has been noted that it counteracts the effects of insulin on phosphoenolpyruvate carboxykinase (PEPCK) gene expression by primarily targeting phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3K) and abrogating downstream insulin signaling in HepG2 cells.
